channel.title: Most stable Resource?
channel.description:
Hello there everyone. Its a long time ago that i've been active on moparscape and for sure the RSC part. Some might still know me as Reborn, owner of ''Endless life'' but i am back again with the new private server gaming community named The Exiled. We currently run a ''World of warcraft server'' but we are willing to open more stable servers.
Question : So i'd like to ask wat is currently the most stable RSC resource so i can start building?
Greetings Reborn.

item.title: Most stable Resource?
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

[quote=“darscape, post:32, topic:337001”]no the most stable resource is frank’s rsc emulator~![/quote]Can anyone reupload WildyLvl21.rom plz

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

no the most stable resource is frank’s rsc emulator~!

Read full topic

item.title: Most stable Resource?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

TheExiled:

But… wat is bad about RSCEasy?

its EasyRSC and it has the same bugs as RSCD, seeing as its the same source, except EasyRSC has a helpful control panel and no login server.

Read full topic

item.title: Most stable Resource?

item.description:

item.title: Most stable Resource?
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

TheExiled:

But guys… if i would use RSCEasy… is that a real bad idea or?

Unless you are capable of finding, fixing and securing all RSCD exploits, then it’s probably your best option.

Read full topic

item.title: Most stable Resource?
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

imthenull: I know what “publicly released” means, but I thought he ment RSCDEF wasn’t publicly released. For instance, it could have been privately released aswell, so that just a few people have it. But that’s not the case. Then also, when I wrote that I was kinda wasted - so I didn’t interpret it properly (I guess).

Read full topic

item.title: Most stable Resource?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

object:

Old Rsc Player: What do you mean not publicly released? Also, TheExiled, I would say RSCD v.25 is more stable than RSCDEF. I cannot really guarantee RSCDEF to be stable at all…

lol 200 rep and dont even know what publicly released means? it means no one released a certain source to the public

Read full topic

item.title: Most stable Resource?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Why would you recommend using BeyondRSC? Unless he wants a specific PK server with all the in-game stat changing (etc) then surely it’s a bad idea… It’s a lot of work restoring it all.

Not really, it’d take maybe an hour to completely undo it…

Read full topic

item.title: Most stable Resource?
item.dc:creator: @TheExiled TheExiled
item.description:
@TheExiled wrote:

Why would you recommend using BeyondRSC? Unless he wants a specific PK server with all the in-game stat changing (etc) then surely it’s a bad idea… It’s a lot of work restoring it all.

item.title: Most stable Resource?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:11, topic:337001”][quote author=TheExiled link=topic=433411.msg3182347#msg3182347 date=1271434193]

Why would you want to use flat text files over a database though? It just doesn’t make sense.

Or use BeyondRSC and make work with a database instead of “flat text files”

seems logic to use a DB 2… but ehh wat exploits are u talking about in RSCD v25?

There are tons, it’s really just easier to start with BeyondRSC, and make it interact with a database…

Not that a good coder myself to transfer it into a DB.
I am kinda a modifier and hoster… i do the payments and the dealing stuff
[/quote]

All the stuff needed is pretty much already on this board…

All you have to do is put some pieces together.[/quote]
Like a puzzle!

Read full topic
